Oh, this guy! I read about him as a teenager. He believed Socrates, Marx and Nietzsche were yetis.
The title of his book periodically jumps into my head, uninvited.

My hottish take is that it's largely driven by an attempt to distinguish himself from one of his major influences, because despite their huge differences in terms of style and politics they both have existentialism and how to face up to death as one of their big themes.

#TBRuary I'm a huge fangirl of Lucius Annaeus Seneca, an Ancient Roman philosopher of Stoicism. ON BENEFITS, one of his collections of moral essays, changed my life. LETTERS ON ETHICS has been on my TBR for a while, but I'm waiting to read it when I have the time for a close study.
